rooms.Name: A workroom
rooms.Description:
Booof's workroom where he keeps the keys to OZ.  This room will get dumped
when OZ goes live!

rooms.Name: A small bedroom
rooms.Description:
You are in a small bedroom that has been heavily damaged.  There is a small
bed here and pieces of broken furniture and bric-a-brac are scattered across
the floor.  A small cracked mirror hangs on the west wall.  The room is
sharply slanted to the north and it is hard to keep your footing.
There is a window to the north and a door to the south.

Exits.Description: The door is made of rogh-hewn planks of wood.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You examine the bed and find nothing interesting.  You do notice that the
initials "DG" are beautifully carved into the top of the headboard.

You look through the window and find that your view is obscured by a dense
growth of shrubs and flowers.  You can almost smell the blooms through the
window panes.

You glance into the mirror and see yourself with a crack through the center
of your forehead.  Hey, you look better than usual!

rooms.Name: The living room
rooms.Description:
The farmhouse living room looks like it has been turned upside down.
Pieces of broken furniture and other odds & ends lie scattered across
the floor which slants sharply to the north.  There are doors to the
west, east, and north.

Exits.Description: There is a door to the north.
You see a sturdy door made of rough hewn planks.
A door leads into the kitchen.

rooms.Name: Munchkin Plaza
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the southwest corner of Munchkin Plaza surrounded by the
hustle and bustle of this charming little village.  To your west you can see
a heavily damaged farmhouse, strangely larger than the other dwellings here.
There is a narrow country road to the south.

Exits.Description: Munchkin Plaza lies before you.
Munchkin Plaza lies before you.
A charming country road leads south from here.
The front porch of a damaged farmhouse is here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
A tiny farmhouse lies to the west.  It is heavily damaged and is slanting 
sharply to one side, as it has fallen from a great height.

rooms.Name: The kitchen
rooms.Description:
Like the rest of the house, the kitchen is a mess with broken pottery and
various kitchen utensils scattered about the floor.  The remains of a plank
table and three chairs are also scattered among the debris.  You do detect the
faint odor of apple pie in the air.

Exits.Description: A door leads to the living room.

rooms.Name: Munchkin Plaza
rooms.Description:
You are the southern part of Munchkin Plaza.  There is a fountain to the
north, a building to the south, and a bridge to the east.

Exits.Description: A beautiful fountain is just to your north.
The entrance to the Munchkin grocery store looks inviting.

rooms.Name: A sturdy bridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a beautifully crafted bridge that spans a fast moving
river below.  Munchkin Plaza is to the west and a beautiful courtyard is
to the east.

Exits.Description: The beautiful waters of the Green River flow south below you.
A beautiful courtyard lies before you.
The beautiful waters of the Green River flow south below you.
Munchkin Plaza lies before you.

ExtraDescs.Description: The sturdy bridge under your feet seems solid and beautifully crafted.

The beautiful, crystal clear water of the Green River flow swiftly towards
the south.

rooms.Name: The Green River
rooms.Description:
You are on a swiftly moving river flowing from north to south.  You can see
a sturdy bridge to the north but the current is moving you away from it.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The bridge to your north is rapidly moving away from you as the currents
take you downriver.

rooms.Name: Under the bridge
rooms.Description:
The strong currents of the Green River have carried you under the bridge in
the center of the Munchkin City.  You notice that there is a narrow ledge to
your east if you could just reach it.  The current is carrying you swiftly
to the south.

rooms.Name: A narrow ledge under the bridge
rooms.Description:
You are crouching on a wet, narrow ledge under the bridge above the swiftly
moving waters of the Green River below.  The ledge is very slippery and the
roar of the currents below are deafening.  It looks treacherous but it may be
possible to climb back up onto shore from here.

rooms.Name: The Green River
rooms.Description:
You are being pulled along by the swift currents of the Green River.  The
riverbanks are too high to climb here.  The Munchkin City is rapidly receding
from view.

rooms.Name: The Green River
rooms.Description:
The powerful currents of the Green River have now taken you far downstream.
You can no longer see the Munchkin City and you hear a deep, roaring sound
coming from downstream that strikes fear in your heart.

rooms.Name: The Green River
rooms.Description:
You are on a swiftly moving river flowing from north to south.  The current
is strong and the water is cold.  To your south you see a bridge spanning
across the river.

ExtraDescs.Description:
A sturdy bridge arches over the river just to the south of you.  You realize
that the currently will take your directly under it.

rooms.Name: The Waterfall
rooms.Description:
The thundering roar just downstream fills your heart with terror as you
realize you are being pulled rapidly towards the edge of a mighty waterfall.
Through the swirling mist you can barely see a rocky landing to your
west.  If you hurry, you just might make it!

Exits.Description: The waterfall looks fast and dangerous.

rooms.Name: The base of the waterfall
rooms.Description:
You've survived the trip over the waterfall and find yourself on a rocky
ledge that is moss covered and very slippery.  Just below you see the entrance
to a cave that you might be able to reach if you jump down carefully.  The
waterfall thunders past you into a narrow gorge.

ExtraDescs.Description: The cave entrace looks narrow but you could probably squeeze through.

rooms.Name: The secret escape route
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the base of a narrow passage that slants up sharply
into the darkness.  Its narrow walls are rough but the angle would make the
climb rather precarious.  There is a heavy trapdoor at your feet.

Exits.Description: The passageway slants up into darkness.
A heavy trapdoor lies at the base of the passage.

rooms.Name: The secret escape route
rooms.Description:
You are climbing up a steeply slanted passageway.  This narrow corridor
has a rough surface but you still worry that you may lose your grip at any
time and slide down into the darkness.

Exits.Description: The passageway slants up into darkness.
The passage slants down into darkness.

rooms.Name: The center of Munchkin Plaza
rooms.Description:
You are at the center of Munchkin Plaza.  Munchkins of all ages gather here
to fill their jars and discuss the latest news in Oz.  A beautiful road made
of yellow bricks is to your north and the swift waters of the Green River is
to your east.
There is a sign by the riverbank.

Exits.Description: The Green River flows quickly by just to your east.

ExtraDescs.Description: The sign reads, "Caution.  Strong currents make swimming hazardous."

rooms.Name: The Mayor's House
rooms.Description:
This is the Mayor of the Munchkin City's office.  It is very tidy and filled
with small pieces of office furniture.  There is a certificate on the wall, 
as well as a picture of the Mayors family.

Exits.Description: A beautiful courtyard is just visible to the west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The picture on the wall is a family portrait of the Mayor's family.  The
Mayor stands smiling next to his wife, surrounded by his twelve children.  You
can guess that the Mayor's hobby might be.

The certificate on the wall is the famous Death Certificate of the Wicked
Witch of the East, nicely autographed by Dorothy Gale herself.

rooms.Name: The Lollipop Guild
rooms.Description:
This is the meeting house for the members of the Lollipop Guild.  The room is
brightly colored but rather messy.  The floor is sticky and littered with
dozens of small lollipop sticks.   There is an odd chart on the wall.

Exits.Description: A beautiful courtyard is visible to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description: There is a chart on the wall outlining the history of the lollipop.
The floor is littered with tiny lollipop sticks.  What a mess!

rooms.Name: The Lullabye League
rooms.Description:
This delightful room is so relaxing that you almost want to lie down and go
to sleep.  The floor is covered with soft cushions, the lights are low, and
soft music is playing in the background.

Exits.Description: A beautiful courtyard is visible to the north.

ExtraDescs.Description: The cushions are big, soft, and look very comfortable.

rooms.Name: A lovely courtyard
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a beautifully landscaped courtyard filled with flower
beds, gravelled walkways, and very small benches.  There is a bridge to the 
west and small, tidy buildings to the north, east, and south.

Exits.Description: The Lollipop Guild house is open for visitors.
The Mayor's office is here.  Perhaps His Honor is in.
The Lullabye League's meeting house looks very quiet.
A sturdy bridge spans the Green River here.

ExtraDescs.Description: This beautifully crafted bench seems a little small for you.
A sturdy-looking bridge crosses the Green River to your west.

These flowers are unusually large and spectacularly colored.  They seem almost
alive as they wave in the breeze.

rooms.Name: Munchkin Plaza
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the northwest corner of Munchkin Plaza.  To the west you
see the entrance to the Gardens of Glinda the Good.  The town fountain is to
the east and a small building is to the north.

rooms.Name: Inside the gates
rooms.Description:
You are standing just inside the massive city gates of the Munchkin City.
The massive oaken gates are bound with iron and are scribed with runes and
other symbols of power.  Beneath your feet lies a road of yellow brick and to
the south lies the charming Munchkin City.

Exits.Description: The city gates stand before you.

rooms.Name: Glinda's Garden
rooms.Description:
You are in the beautiful garden of Glinda the Good.  Elegantly landscaped
flowerbeds full of spectacular blooms are planted here along with lifelike
topiary and gravelled walkways.  High hedges surround the small garden though
you notice that the south hedge has been crushed by a small house that appears
to have fallen from the sky.  The intoxicating scent of the garden make you
feel peaceful and relaxed.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The farmhouse is partially buried into the ground and is heavily damaged.
When you look through the window you see what appears to be a small bedroom.

rooms.Name: The Gazebo
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of a charming gazebo.  Vines covered with
yellow and green flowers cover the intricate lattice work walls.  A stunning
mosaic of Glinda The Good has been painstaking laid onto the floor.  As you 
gaze at the mosaic, you get the eerie sense that the image is actually looking
at you.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This beautiful portrait is composed of thousands of tiny gems painstakingly
cemented onto the floor.  The portrait of Glinda seems amazingly lifelike as
you can almost sense the image looking at you.  The beautiful mosaic has been
initialled by the artist, "NTSC".

rooms.Name: Munchmart
rooms.Description:
You are in a tidy little store filled with all kind of things Munchkins
love to buy.  All of the items seem rather small and don't really interest 
you.  The store is impeccably clean and all of the goods are precisely 
arranged in alphabetical order on the shelves behind the counter.

rooms.Name: The Slippery Landing
rooms.Description:
This pebble-strewn landing is on the west bank of the Green River, just
before the river plunges over a huge waterfall.  Swirling mists obscure your
view of the waterfall and its thunder deafens you.
There is a message scrawled on the rock here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The message reads, "Toad, Bart, and the others went over the falls in search
of the Nome King's Kingdom.  I knew that I could never survive the falls so have
been forced to turn back.
                        - Newt the newbie

rooms.Name: A narrow path
rooms.Description:
A narrow path winds it way up from the river bank to the top of a ridge.
A small farm can be seen below the ridge but if you jump down you might not
be able to climb back up onto the ridge.  The view from here is breathtaking
with the Green River Waterfall to your east and the Munchkin City visible to
the north.

rooms.Name: The cornfield
rooms.Description:
This carefully cultivated field has row after row of huge stalks of corn
that seem to be exploding out of the ground.  Whoever farms this field must
really know what they are doing!  There is a country road to the west on the
other side of a split rail fence.  There is a cozy farmhouse to the north with
smoke billowing from its chimney.  The outskirts of the Munchkin City can be
seen to the north and a steep line of ridges is to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You can barely detect a narrow path at the top of the ridge but the slope
is too steep to climb.

rooms.Name: The country road
rooms.Description:
This narrow country road lined with split rail fences leads through some
beautiful farmland filled with acres and acres of corn.  There is a small
farmhouse to the east with smoke billowing gently from its chimney.  You can
see the outskirts of the Munchkin City to the north and a line of steep ridges
to the south.

rooms.Name: A cozy farmhouse
rooms.Description:
This cozy farmhouse is warmed by a glowing fire in a large stone fireplace.
This one room dwelling has a small bed, a table, and a couple small chairs.
Farm implements are hung neatly on hooks and everything is meticulously clean.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This plain wooden table is where the farmer probably eats his meals.
The worn surface is stained and coated with grease.

This small stone fireplace is neatly crafted from large stones and mortar.
It is heavily blackened from constant use and embers from the latest fire
still glow within its depths.

This small bed is made of highly polished pine and looks like someone slept
in it recently.  The mattress is quite lumpy and you realize that it is 
stuffed with corn stalks and sheaves.

This small chair looks sturdy enough to hold your weight but is probably too
small to be comfortable.

rooms.Name: A country road
rooms.Description:
The country road runs between acres and acres of corn that are just on the
other side of the sturdy split rail fences that line the road.  To the south,
the road ends at a squat, dark dwelling that makes you want to turn and head
north back to the Munchkin City.
There is a sign here.

ExtraDescs.Description: The sign reads simply, "Turn Back."

rooms.Name: Mombi's house
rooms.Description:
The interior of this dark, musty dwelling is full of arcane equipment,
dusty tomes, and all matter of disgusting objects in jars.  A cauldron is
bubbling over a sooty fireplace and is emitting a foul, unpleasant odor.  The
floor is covered with all sorts of disgusting spilled fluids and is swarming
with vermin.  Perhaps it would be a good idea to leave!

Exits.Description: A cracked and peeling door is here.
A heavy trap door here leads to the cellar.

rooms.Name: Glinda's Chamber of Summoning
rooms.Description:
This unearthly room fills you with a sense of awe and a peaceful feeling
laced with a touch of fear.  The walls and floor appear to be made of swirling
mists and the stars can be seen shining overhead.  An ornate chair carved
from the purest crystal is next to a massive desk covered with dusty tomes 
and various arcane devices.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This elegant desk is littered with unusual devices and other tools of the
practitioner of the magic arts.  You are careful not to touch anything!

This chair has been cut from a monstrous crystal gem.  It has been carefully
chiselled and carved with floral embellishments.  Surprisingly, it looks
rather comfortable.

rooms.Name: The farmhouse porch
rooms.Description:
The small porch on the front of the farmhouse probably once held some chairs
where the owners relaxed at the end of the day.  Now the floorboards are 
loose or missing, the railing is broken, and no signs of the chairs remain.

Exits.Description: The Munchkin Plaza lies just east of you.
You see a weathered door with a tarnished brass knob.

rooms.Name: Outside the gates
rooms.Description:
You are standing outside of the city gates of the Munchkin City.  Twin guard
houses are set into the walls and you can see Munchkin guards lining the
parapets.  The yellow brick road leads north into the lush countryside.

Exits.Description: The city gates stand before you.

rooms.Name: Outskirts of town
rooms.Description:
You are on the yellow brick road, just north of the Munchkin City.  Broad
expanses of farmland stretch as far as the eye can see.  Tiny farmhouses and
barns dot the countryside under the spectacular Oz sky.  There is a crossroads
to the north.

rooms.Name: A fork in the road
rooms.Description:
You are standing at a fork in the yellow brick road.  You can walk to the
east, west, or south.  The split rail fence that lines the road here is broken
to the north.  You could climb over it and go into the cornfield if you
wanted to.
There is a sign here with an arrow pointing south.

ExtraDescs.Description: The sign reads, "Munchkin City - 1 mile."

rooms.Name: The cornfield
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a cornfield that stretches north as far as the eye can
see.  There is a small clearing here but the field is too densely planted for
you to try and walk any further into the field.  The yellow brick road is to
your south.

rooms.Name: Mombi's cellar
rooms.Description:
This dark, dank, awful smelling cellar is swarming with vermin and covered
with cobwebs and a heavy layer of dust.  Pieces of bone crunch underfoot while
you stoop below the greasy rafters.

Exits.Description: A heavy trap door here leads back upstairs.

rooms.Name: The yellow brick road
rooms.Description:
The road runs through lush farmlands where well-tended fields of corn, wheat,
and unusual vegetables cover the gently rolling countryside.  To the east you
can see a round, dome-roofed farmhouse and an adjacent barn.

rooms.Name: The farmyard
rooms.Description:
This farmyard is surrounded by a well-constructed fence and leads to both
the farmhouse and the barn.  A wagon is parked near the south side of the yard
and wheel ruts cross-cross the yard.  Acres and acres of crops are visible
behind the barn.

Exits.Description: The barn doors lead into the barn.
The farmhouse door leads into the house.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This simple wagon has four spoked wheels made of wood and a narrow bench for
the driver.  A leather harness for hitching a horse to the wagon is laid on
the bench.

rooms.Name: Farmer Boq's house
rooms.Description:
The interior of this rustic farmhouse is filled with simple furniture and
is carefully swept and cleaned.  A stone fireplace contains glowing embers
from a fire that has long since gone out.

Exits.Description: The front door of the farmhouse is the only exit.
A barely noticable trapdoor is at your feet.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The fireplace is constructed of small stones carefully mortared together.
A heavy oak mantel is hung above the soot-blackened grate.

rooms.Name: The barn
rooms.Description:
The interior of the barn is filled with bales of hay and sacks of feed.
There are a few stalls here and several farm implements hang from hooks
on the wall.  The air is filled with the smell of must and manure and
you can hear the scurry of fieldmice.

Exits.Description: The barn doors are the only exit.

rooms.Name: The yellow brick road
rooms.Description:
The yellow brick road run through the lush Munchkin farmland.  There is an
occasional tree alongside the road and you notice some woodlands to the west.

rooms.Name: The edge of the forest
rooms.Description:
At the edge of the forest, tall trees and dense shrubbery begin to crowd the
sides of the yellow brick road.  You can hear an occasional bird call and
the howl of some lonely animal.  Weeds sprout up between the bricks of the
road here and you must walk carefully over the uneven surface.

rooms.Name: The deep forest
rooms.Description:
The yellow brick road is in poor repair here, deep inside the forest.  The
dense canopy of trees completely block your view of the sky and the area is
unusually quiet.  To the south, there is a grove of apple trees.

rooms.Name: The enchanted orchard
rooms.Description:
This small orchard has huge, gnarled apple trees that must be very old.  The
ground is littered with rotten apples whose sweet smell is overpowering.  You
get the distinct impression that someone is watching you.

rooms.Name: The deep forest
rooms.Description:
You are now in the deepest part of the forest where huge trees tower over
your head.  The yellow brick road is in very poor shape here and is partially
overgrown.  You notice that someone has been chopping down the trees here as
numerous stumps can be seen inside the forest.  A narrow path leads north.

rooms.Name: The clearing
rooms.Description:
This wide clearing is surrounded by stacks of lumber and freshly hewn logs.
Wood chips and sawdust make the ground underfoot feel as soft as a carpet.
A small cottage is nestled within the trees to the west.
There is a sign hung above the cottage door.

Exits.Description: The front door to the cottage looks very sturdy.

ExtraDescs.Description: The sign reads, "Nick Chopper."

rooms.Name: The cottage
rooms.Description:
This rustic dwelling is masterfully constructed of logs and boards that have
been cut to fit together with extraordinary precision.  A beautiful carving
has been lovingly cut into the wall over the fireplace and is the small
cottages only decoration.  The floor is covered with sawdust and the smell of
machine oil lingers in the air.

Exits.Description: The door to the cottage lead back to the clearing.

ExtraDescs.Description: The fireplace looks as if it has never been used.

This elaborate carving portrays a scene where a small girl with a dog, a
lion, a scarecrow, and a tin man are talking with a little man in a beautiful
throne room.

rooms.Name: The deep forest
rooms.Description:
This section of the woods is densely covered with an increasing number of
pine trees and scrubby growth.  The yellow brick road is heavily overgrown
here and you must pay close attention not to get lost among the trees.

rooms.Name: The edge of the woods
rooms.Description:
The trees are rather sparse here at the edge of the forest.  To the east
the yellow brick road plunges deeply into the heart of an ancient forest.
To the west you can see some rocky hills on the horizon.

rooms.Name: The foothills
rooms.Description:
Standing at the base of some rolling foothills, the yellow brick road winds
up and over the hills to the west and disappears from sight.  A dense forest
looms menacingly to the east.  A small path follows the ridge to the south.

rooms.Name: The top of the ridge
rooms.Description:
Standing here on the top of the ridge gives you a magnificent view of the
countryside.  Far below to the west a deep chasm slices sharply across the
landscape from north to south as far as the eye can see.  To the east a dense
forest covers the land and disappears into the mists.  The wind is blowing
cold from the west and a shiver runs down your spine.

rooms.Name: The side of the ridge
rooms.Description:
The yellow brick road is reduced to a narrow path here as it winds its way
along the side of a steep ridge.  The wind is blowing strongly here and the
gravel underfoot makes walking here rather treacherous.  Through some hardy
trees you can see a chasm below.
There is a sign here bolted to the rock.

ExtraDescs.Description: The sign reads, "Toll Bridge Ahead."

rooms.Name: The side of the chasm
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the edge of a precipace looking down at the rocks far
below.  Two massive stone columns are built here which once supported a bridge
that spanned the chasm.  Across to the west you can see the yellow brick road
continue west into a field of brightly colored flowers.

rooms.Name: The tunnel entrance
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the entrance of a long tunnel that slopes steeply into
the ground.  The sounds of the waterfall outside is slightly muffled here and
you can feel very cold air blowing up from the depths.  There are some bones
scattered about here.  Perhaps they are a warning!

rooms.Name: The sloping tunnel
rooms.Description:
This rough-hewn tunnel is fairly steep and you have to watch your footing
very carefully.  You can see some faint light from the tunnel entrance above
but the tunnel below is pitch black.  You can hear faint sounds of dripping
water in the distance.

rooms.Name: Near the bottom
rooms.Description:
The steeply slanting tunnel is beginning to level out towards the bottom.
You can now clearly hear the sound of running water and can feel the heavy
moisture in the air.  You feel slightly claustrophobic as you realize just 
how far beneath the ground you are.

rooms.Name: The blue grotto
rooms.Description:
This large grotto is eerily illuminated by a blue glow given off by the
luminescent moss that grows in abundance here.  A small waterfall pours over
the southern side of the grotto and disappears into a rock vent below.

Exits.Description: A granite door is behind the waterfall here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
As you look at the waterfall you an detect the outline of a door on the other
side of the falling water.  The spray leaves an unpleasant taste in your mouth.

rooms.Name: The crystal cave
rooms.Description:
This spectacular chamber is lined with brilliant crystals of various hues.
The glitter from the reflected light almost dazzles you as you gaze in awe at
this glorious display of nature's wonder.

Exits.Description: The door here has a sign reading "OFFICE" on it.

rooms.Name: The opal cave
rooms.Description:
As you stand in the middle of this cavern, exotic swarms of constellations
cover the walls and ceilings.  As you look closer, you realize that the stars
are actually milky white opals that gleam with a soft, delicate light.

rooms.Name: The root cellar
rooms.Description:
This tiny room is damp and dark.  The dirt floor is slightly uneven but has
been packed hard from constant use.  A wooden ladder leads up to a trapdoor.

Exits.Description: The ladder leads up to a trapdoor.

rooms.Name: The entrance tunnel
rooms.Description:
This tunnel shows considerable wear as if many have passed this way before you.
There is a heavy granite door to the north and the passage slopes gently
downward to the south.  You can detect the faint sound of falling water to the
north.

Exits.Description: A heavy granite door stands before you.

rooms.Name: The Stalagmite Cave
rooms.Description:
The floor of this large cavern is densely covered with majestic stalagmites
which tower over your head.  You realize that you could easily become lost
within this spectacular underground forest of stone.

rooms.Name: The Stalagmite Cave
rooms.Description:
The floor of this large cavern is densely covered with majestic stalagmites
which tower over your head.  You realize that you could easily become lost
within this spectacular underground forest of stone.

rooms.Name: The Stalagmite Cave
rooms.Description:
The floor of this large cavern is densely covered with majestic stalagmites
which tower over your head.  You realize that you could easily become lost
within this spectacular underground forest of stone.

rooms.Name: The Stalagmite Cave
rooms.Description:
The floor of this large cavern is densely covered with majestic stalagmites
which tower over your head.  You realize that you could easily become lost
within this spectacular underground forest of stone.

rooms.Name: The Stalagmite Cave
rooms.Description:
The floor of this large cavern is densely covered with majestic stalagmites
which tower over your head.  You realize that you could easily become lost
within this spectacular underground forest of stone.

Exits.Description: A trapdoor is barely noticable beneath your feet.

rooms.Name: The ruby cavern
rooms.Description:
This cavern has a rosy glow that comes from the spectacular rubies that have
been mined here by the busy Nome workers.  Heavy clusters of raw gemstones
can clearly be seen in the numerous veins of ore that crisscross the walls of
the cave.

rooms.Name: The emerald cave
rooms.Description:
This large cave has been heavily mined and most of the gemstones removed.
Scattered across the cave walls small, low grade emeralds can be seen but
they are obviously not good enough for the Nomes.  You can't help but wonder
where all of the good emeralds have gone!

Exits.Description: A cleverly disguised door is hidden in the floor here.

rooms.Name: The dark shaft
rooms.Description:
This narrow shaft is barely wide enough for you to move through.  Stooping
in the passage, you can tell that this passage was crudely excavated unlike
the beautifully chiselled passageways created by the Nomes throughout their
kingdom.

Exits.Description: A small secret trapdoor is within reach overhead.

It is very dark below and a foul smell wafts up from the darkness.  The 
walls look slippery and treacherous.

rooms.Name: The dark shaft
rooms.Description:
You have fallen from the slippery walls and landed at the bottom of the
dark shaft.  The rancid piles of garbage cushioned your fall and saved your
life.  The insects and foul odor makes you want to get out of here!

Exits.Description: A slippery shaft rises into darkness above you.

rooms.Name: The Foreman's Office
rooms.Description:
This cramped room carved from living rock is used by the Nome Foreman in
charge of the mines.  Charts depicting gemstone and ore production are on the
walls and a desk and chair carved from stone are in the center of the room.
Everything is bathed with the cool, blue light given off by the luminescent
moss that covers the ceiling.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The chair looks very sturdy and very uncomfortable.  The seat is polished
from heavy use.

The desk is scattered with the usual office debris.  It seems odd that there
are no drawers.
It appears that the Nomes have been very, very busy.
It appears that the Nomes have been very, very busy.

rooms.Name: The furnace room
rooms.Description:
This cavern is brightly lit by the roaring flames of a large furnace.  Nome
workers scurry in and out of the room, smelting precious ores and carrying 
the precious ingots away to the King's secret storerooms.  The heat is very
oppressive and you feel yourself growing strangely tired.

Exits.Description: The heavy cast iron door seem to glow in the heat.
A trapdoor cleverly cut into the rock is above your head.

rooms.Name: The furnace
rooms.Description:
Gigantic flames leap about you searing your skin and causing sweat to burst
from your pores.  The incredible heat almost suffocates you as the fire nearly
blinds you with its incandescent fury.

Exits.Description: The furnace door is cast iron and glowing in the heat.
A dirty steel flu is above you.

rooms.Name: The gem cutters workroom
rooms.Description:
This narrow chamber is brightly lit by a light source you can't seem to
identify.  The floor is littered with piles of stone chips and other debris
created by the gem cutters and jewelers that labor here creating treasures for
the Nome King.

Exits.Description: A crimson glow radiates warmly from the cave opening.

rooms.Name: The antechamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber has been neatly carved out of the rock and has a huge door cast
from some unearthly metal hung on massive hinges on the northern wall.  An
ornate letter 'N' has been engraved deeply onto the surface of the door.  You
perceive an aura of magic and a sense of foreboding as you stand here.

rooms.Name: The Nome King's throne room
rooms.Description:
This spectacular chamber is brightly lit with the reflected light of the
thousands of gemstones that are set into every square inch of the walls and
ceiling.  A majestic tapestry depicting the Nome Kingdom hangs behind the
gigantic carved emerald that is the Nome King's throne.  Massive pillars
carved with scenes of the King's numerous victories with his massive armies
tower over your head.

Exits.Description: A massive, enchanted metal door guards the throne room.
A heavy tapestry is hung behind the throne.

ExtraDescs.Description:
A single enormous emerald gemstone wearing more than a ton has been carved
into a throne for the King of the Nomes.

These pillars have heavily stylized depictions of battles and victory
processions carved over their entire surface.

The heavy tapestry hung behind the throne has lifelike scenes depicting the
Nome Kingdom's various caverns, caves, and grottos.

rooms.Name: Roquat's chambers
rooms.Description:
This surprisingly small bedroom is where the King obviously relaxes after a
long day of ruling his enormous Kingdom.  A soft sandstone bed and a small
writing desk are set next to a fairly large gilt mirror on the wall.  There
is a small door to the south and a secret passage to the throneroom to the
east.

Exits.Description: A large, ornate mirror is hung on the wall here.
The dusty back of an ancient tapestry hangs before you.
A small rock door is set into the wall.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The King's desk is rather nondescript.  It looks like it has not been used
very often.

You notice that your image is strangely elongated in the mirror.  You look
quite a bit taller in it.

The bed looks surprisingly soft and comfortable.  You feel a sudden urge to
lie down and rest for a while.

rooms.Name: Kaliko's room
rooms.Description:
thThis austere bedchamber is where the Nome King's steward sleeps.  It is next
to the King's chambers so that Kaliko can quickly respond to the demands of
the fiery ruler of the Nomes.  A simple sandstone bed is the only thing you
see here.

Exits.Description: A small rock door is set into the wall.

rooms.Name: the King's Treasure Room
rooms.Description:
This small room is featureless and is covered with a heavy blanket of dust.
The remains of heavy shelving can be seen along the walls and the imprints of
large square objects can be seen on the floor.  It appears that the King's
many campaigns has seriously depleted the royal treasury.

Exits.Description: The back of a mirror is hinged and set into the wall here.
A heavy trapdoor is set into the ceiling.

rooms.Name: The beaten path
rooms.Description:
A narrow dirt path cuts across the base of the ridge.  The path looks well
travelled and you notice faint footprints of a large animal.  The yellow brick
road can be seen to the north, emerging from the forests to the east.  The
path continues to the south.

rooms.Name: The beaten path
rooms.Description:
This narrow path follows along the base of a long ridge that runs north and
south.  Heavy boulders and rocks pepper the edge of the path, probably the
result of rockslides from the ridge above you.  As you glance at the ridge,
you notice an almost invisible path snaking up through the rocks.

rooms.Name: The rocky trail
rooms.Description:
This barely noticable trail leads up into the rocky ledge from the dirt path
below.  The footing is rather treacherous here and you worry that a sudden
gust of wind might blow you off of the side of the ridge.  High above your
head you notice what appears to be a cave opening.

rooms.Name: The end of the path
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the base of a rocky ridge surrounded by boulders and
scattered rocks and gravel.  Coarse undergrowth blocks your passage to the
south and east while a dirt path leads north.

rooms.Name: Outside the cave
rooms.Description:
You are teetering on a very  narrow ledge outside of a dark cave entrance.
A cold draft is emanating from the cave and it carries a dank, sour animal
smell.  You notice some well chewed bones crunching beneath your feet and a
narrow trail works its way through the rocks to the base of the ridge.  The
wind is blowing gustily, perhaps you should get moving?

rooms.Name: Inside the cave
rooms.Description:
You are standing just inside of a cave entrance, standing on a thick carpet
of well-chewed and splintered bones.  A heavy, sour smell fills the air, as
well as the unmistakable odor of rot and decay.  Muffled sounds and sharp,
cracking sounds are coming from the depths of the cave.

rooms.Name: A rocky passage
rooms.Description:
This rocky passage is twisted and uneven, making you pick your way carefully
across the rock-strewn floor.  The smell of rot is very strong here, and ice
cold drops of water fall on you from above.  When you reach out to steady
yourself, the rocks are cold and slippery to the touch.  You hear sounds from
deeper within the cavern that sound like large beasts or worse!

Exits.Description: The chimney leading down looks steep and dangerous.

rooms.Name: The chimney
rooms.Description:
You find yourself at the bottom of a steep chimney through the rock that
leads into the darkness above.  The uneven sides of the chimney offer lots of
handholds but their slippery surfaces make them dangerous to depend on, as 
you already realize.  You feel crowded in and claustrophic in this cramped
crevice in the rock.

rooms.Name: The Kalidah's lair
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the lair of the fearsome Kalidahs who terrorize all
living things within their territory.  The floor is covered with splintered
bones and shreds of rotting flesh from the prey of these fearsome creatures.
The smell of rot is overwhelming here, as is your desire to flee this vile
and disgusting cave.

Exits.Description: A trapdoor fashioned of bones is beneath your feet.

rooms.Name: The long passage
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the eastern end of a long passage that slants down
towards the west.  The walls of the passage are unnaturally precise and even
indicating that the passage was created by magical means.  A heavy layer of
dust covers the floor, indicating that this passage has not been used for
many years.

Exits.Description: A trapdoor fashioned of bones is above your head.

rooms.Name: The long passage
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a magically crafted passageway that slants down sharply
to the west.  The floor is covered with dust and you notice that the passage
is illuminated from some unknown source.

Exits.Description: A secret door is concealed within the rock wall here.

rooms.Name: The long passage
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a magically crafted passageway that slants sharply down
to the west.  The floor is covered with dust and the passage is mysteriously
illuminated from some magical source.  From here, the weight of the earth
above you is palpable and you hurry to escape feeling trapped.

rooms.Name: The long passage
rooms.Description:
You are in a magically crafted passageway that slants sharply up to both the
east and the west.  The enchanted illumination here helps you detect that you
are standing at the lowest point of the long passage and you realize that you
have a long climb ahead of you, no matter which way you go.

rooms.Name: The long passage
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a magically crafted passage that leads up steeply to the
west.  The floor is covered with dust and a strange, enchanted light seems to
come from the very walls themselves.

rooms.Name: The end of a long passage
rooms.Description:
You are at the western end of the long passage which leads deeply into the
bowels of the earth to the east.  The passageway ends abruptly, it appears
that it was never finished.  Lucky, there is a ladder here leading up into
a hole in the ceiling.

Exits.Description: A heavy trapdoor is at the top of the ladder.

rooms.Name: The poppy field
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the eastern edge of a vast field of poppies, whose heady
perfume makes you feel strangely sleepy.  To the west, the magnificent spires
of the Emerald City rise high into the sky.  The spectacular Oz sky has an
odd greenish tint here where wispy clouds drift high above the horizon.

Exits.Description: Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
A crossroads is visible past the edge of the poppy field.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
The Emerald City looms at the edge of the field of poppies.

rooms.Name: The secret escape route
rooms.Description:
You are climbing a steep passageway whose uneven surface is barely enough
to keep you from sliding down into the darkness below.  You detect a slight
breeze here and there seems to be some light coming from above.

Exits.Description: You can detect light and a slight breeze coming from the passage above.
The passageway slants down into darkness.

rooms.Name: The chimney
rooms.Description:
This narrow chimney rises far above your head.  Its walls are heavily coated
with soot and grime and are quite slippery.  A heavy sense of claustrophobia
almost overwhelms you here as the heat from below makes you break out into
a heavy sweat.

Exits.Description: The chimney extends into the blackness above.
A heavy iron flu lies beneath your feet glowing in the heat.

rooms.Name: The chimney
rooms.Description:
The sooty walls of the chimney make it difficult for you to move up or down,
and you fear you may lose your grip at any moment.  The searing heat and the
heavy clouds of rancid smoke make your eyes sting and water, making it hard
to see where you are going.  You can see a light high above you.

Exits.Description: The chimney extends far above your head.  You see a light high above.
A fire glows dimly far below you.

rooms.Name: The chimney
rooms.Description:
You are clinging to the soot-encrusted walls of a long chimney chiseled
through solid rock.  Luckily the uneven surface offers many handholds but
the greasy, sooty stone is slippery.  The smoke stings your eyes and the heat
is oppressive.  You can see what may be an opening up above.

Exits.Description: The chimney rises above your head.  You see a light in the distance.
The dark chimney extends far beneath your feet.

rooms.Name: The chimney
rooms.Description:
You are near the top of a smoke-filled chimney that has sooty, slippery
walls.  You sense a tremendous distance under your feet and you realize that
one slip will send your plunging to your death.  Above your head is the top
of the chimney and you get an occasional gust of fresh air.

Exits.Description: The top of the chimney is visible from here.
The chimney shaft plunges into an inky blackness.

rooms.Name: The mountaintop
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a narrow plateau at the summit of a mountain whose sheer
sides look deadly and unclimbable.  The smoking chimney at your feet does
little to lessen the beauty and grandeur of the mountain range that surrounds
you.  You can see a spectacular waterfall far to the north and the edges of a
vast desert far to the west.  The air is cold and clear, and sharp gusts of
wind tug at your feet.  There is a small cave entrance to the south.

Exits.Description: A small cave opening is just to your south.
The smoke-filled chimney looks hot and uninviting.

rooms.Name: The Jackdaw's nest
rooms.Description:
The Jackdaw's nest is filled with tons of junk collected by these huge birds
and brought back to line their nest.  Scraps of clothing, bottles, pieces of
wood, bones, and all manner of useless stuff create a thick carpet of trash
on the floor of this small cave.  The air has a sour, unpleasant odor here
but an occasional gust of fresh air from outside helps a great deal.  You
poke around some but find nothing of interest.

Exits.Description: You can see a beautiful mountain range outside the cave entrance.

rooms.Name: The crossroads
rooms.Description:
You are standing at a crossroads on the yellow brick road.  A deep canyon
is to the east but the bridge that once spanned the gorge is long gone.  You
can see the Emerald City to the west on the far side of a large field of
poppies.  The yellow brick road also leads north and south.
There is a signpost here.

Exits.Description: A huge field of poppies lie between you and the Emerald City.
A trapdoor is cleverly concealed in the ground here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The signpost reads:  North - Quadling Country
                     South - Winkies Country
                      East - Munchkin Country
                      West - Emerald City

rooms.Name: The secret storeroom
rooms.Description:
This small room must have been used to store supplies and equipment by the
creators of the long passage you have been travelling down.  A heavy layer of
dust proves that no one has been here for some time.  The air is stale and
water drips slowly from the ceiling.

Exits.Description: A secret door leads back into the tunnel.

rooms.Name: South of the crossroads
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the yellow brick road just south of a crossroads.  You
can see a large poppy field to the northwest and the distant spires of the
Emerald City.  The road runs south towards a dark and ancient forest.

Exits.Description: You see a crossroads in the distance.
A dark and mysterious forest looms nearby to the south.

rooms.Name: North of the dark forest
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the yellow brick road, just north of a huge expanse of
dark forest that stretches south towards the horizon.  You get the distinct
feeling that something evil but intangible lurks within and is waiting for
you hungrily.  Oddly, the yellow brick road ends abruptly at the edge of the
forest with an edge that could have been cut with a knife.  A dark path leads
south into the depths of the forest.

Exits.Description: A dark and menacing wood looms ahead.

rooms.Name: A country lane
rooms.Description:
You are walking along a narrow, rutted country lane.  You can see some vast
wheat fields on either side of the lane, on the other side of the split rail
fences that keep you from walking in the fields.  The air is hot and dry, and
dust blows across the dry fields.  You can see a huge storm front off in the
distance to the south.

Exits.Description: Some sort of statue lies to the north.

rooms.Name: The country lane
rooms.Description:
You are on a rutted country road that runs from north to south through the
Kansas countryside.  You can see a farm just to the south, and you can see a
huge storm brewing just beyond it.  The wind is beginning to blow in sharp
gusts and you sense a major storm is brewing.

rooms.Name: A country lane
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a narrow, rutted country lane that runs by an old, worn
farmhouse and outbuildings to the east.  The farm looks strangely deserted,
possibly because of the huge storm that seems to be brewing.  The wind is
blowing fiercely here, and the dust makes your eyes water.  You can see a
black swirling column of dust to the southeast.

Exits.Description: A wide wooden gate leads to a farm to the east.

rooms.Name: The barnyard
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of a small Kansas farm.  The barn and farm
equipment look worn and badly in need of repair.  The foundation to a small
building is to the north.  The stacks of lumber nearby are probably going to
be used to build a farmhouse here.  The farm is oddly deserted, probably
because of the tremendous storm approaching from the south.  With the roar
of a freight train, a huge twister is making its way across the wheat fields.

Exits.Description: A sun bleached wooden door leads into the barn.
A wide gate leads back to a dirt road.

rooms.Name: The barn
rooms.Description:
This dusty barn is in ill repair.  The howling winds outside pour through
the many holes in the walls, causing the straw on the floor to fly around
your head.  The barn smells like horses and manure, but there is no sign of
any animals here.

Exits.Description: The barn door is hanging by a single hinge.

rooms.Name: The foundation
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the damaged foundation of what must have been a small
farmhouse here.  The torn and twisted beams and supports make it appear as
if the house was simply wrenched off of its foundations.  There are several
stacks of lumber nearby.  The farmer must be planning to rebuild the house
for his family.  The howling storm to the south makes you wonder if a
tornado might have destroyed the house.

ExtraDescs.Description: The lumber is composed of crudely-sawn pine boards.
The stacks of lumber are composed of crudely sawn pine boards.

rooms.Name: The wheat field
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the northern edge of a huge wheat field, just south
of some farm buildings.  Through the howling winds and the choking dust you
can see a black, twisting funnel cloud slowly windings its way across the
field.  You can just make out a small storm cellar to your east, perhaps
you had better get in before the twister reaches you.

Exits.Description: A small barn and farmhouse are just to the north.
A small storm cellar is beside the barn.
A winds from a huge twister is pulling at you.

rooms.Name: The storm cellar
rooms.Description:
This dark little hole in the ground is used to escape the violent tornados
that constantly move through the Mid-West.  In better times, it is also
used as a cool place to store food.  Time must be hard because the only
thing you find here is dust.

Exits.Description: A sturdy door leads back to the fields.

rooms.Name: Inside the twister
rooms.Description:
You have been sucked up into the funnel cloud of a massive tornado and
are being tossed helplessly around and around by the violent winds.  It is
hard to breath and the deafening shriek of the twister makes it difficult 
to think.  You notice that by moving your arms and legs, you can deflect
the winds a little bit and move through the air currents.

rooms.Name: Inside the twister
rooms.Description:
You have been sucked into the funnel cloud of a massive tornado and
are being tossed helplessly around and around by the violent winds.  It is
hard to breath and the deafening shriek of the twister makes it difficult
to think.  You notice that by moving you arms and legs, you can deflect
the winds a little bit and move through the air currents.

rooms.Name: Inside the twister
rooms.Description:
You have been sucked up into the funnel cloud of a massive tornado and
are being tossed helplessly around and around by the violent winds.  It is
hard to breath and the deafening shriek of the twister makes it difficult
to think.  You notice that by moving your arms and legs, you can deflect
the winds a little bit and move through the air currents.

rooms.Name: Inside the twister
rooms.Description:
You have been sucked up into the funnel cloud of a massive tornado and
are being tossed helplessly around and around by the violent winds.  It is
hard to breath and the deafening shriek of the twister makes it difficult
to think.  You notice that by moving your arms and legs, you can deflect
the winds a little bit and move through the air currents.

Exits.Description: Through the swirling winds you can just make out the top of a tree.

rooms.Name: The treetop
rooms.Description:
You are in the upper branches of a small tree that grows in the center
of a small landscaped courtyard below.  Through the leaves you get glimpses
of a small town below with rather small people moving about.  There are
several buildings visible and a beautiful river can be seen to the west.
You can easily drop down to the ground from here.

Exits.Description: The ground below looks safe to drop down to from here.

rooms.Name: A turn in the lane
rooms.Description:
The country lane turns here, running both north and west.  A huge storm
is blowing just east of here.  You can clearly see a giant funnel cloud
moving across the wheat fields.  The wind is blowing sharply and the dust
makes it difficult to see very far down the road.

Exits.Description: A bridge and a wagon are visible down the road.

rooms.Name: Next to the bridge
rooms.Description:
The lane ends abruptly against a small bridge that has just been washed 
out by a flash flood that churns just below the river bank, caused probably
by the massive storm you can see to the east.  An ornate gypsy wagon is here
next to a small campfire.  Someone is obviously camping out here next to
the river.

Exits.Description: An ornate door is at the rear of the gypsy wagon.

ExtraDescs.Description:
A small campfire is sputtering in the wind here, inside of a small ring
of stones.

This worn gypsy wagon must have been beautiful when it was new.  Traces of
gilt paint are still visible on its sun-weathered exterior.  One the side
the words "Professor Marvel - Acclaimed By The Crowned Heads of Europe -
Let Him Read Your Past - Present & Future In His Crystal."

The wooden bridge has been washed out in the flash flood.  The heavy
wooden beams have been ripped away by the flood waters.

The waters of the river are churning violently as they flow past.  The
white water looks dangerous and is full of debris.

rooms.Name: Professor Marvel's Wagon
rooms.Description:
The interior of the wagon is cluttered with all kinds of odd contraptions,
yellowing newspapers and old tin cans.  The ornately carved walls have seen
better days, as has the dusty carpet on the floor.  There is a small table
and two chairs in the center of the wagon.

Exits.Description: You can hear the wind blowing outside the door.

rooms.Name: The dark forest
rooms.Description:
You are standing in an inky black forest full of huge trees, brambles,
dense underrowth, and swarming vermin that rustle underfoot.  To the north,
the path leads out of the woods where the Yellow Brick Road is just barely
visible.  The forest is unnaturally silent and unusually cold.

Exits.Description: The edge of the forest looms ahead.
The heavy undergrowth hides what's ahead from view.

rooms.Name: The dark forest
rooms.Description:
You are in a dark, evil forest surrounded by trees whose jagged branches
seem to tear at your clothes.  Thorny undergrowth scratches your hands and
face as you work your way through along a narrow path.  The forest is silent
and cold and fills you with a sense of foreboding.
There is a sign here.

Exits.Description: The dark forest obscures your view.
A clearing is barely visible just ahead.
The dense undergrowth obscures your view.

ExtraDescs.Description: The signs reads simply, "GO BACK."

rooms.Name: Under the fallen tree
rooms.Description:
The narrow path winds beneath a huge fallen tree whose massive bulk creaks
noisily and shifts in the otherwise silent forest.  A cold, sour wind blows
through the forest, making you shiver from both fear and the icy gusts.

Exits.Description: The dark forest hides everything from view.
The path ends here and the dark wood lies ahead.
You can easily reach the tree and climb up onto it from the path.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The tree once stood to the south of the path and has fallen over, resting
against some large trees to the north.  Unpleasant-looking vines and insects
cover the rotting bark.  It looks unpleasant but you think you could reach
up and climb along the tree trunk up into the trees to the north.

rooms.Name: The small clearing
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a small clearing where a battle was fought some time
ago.  The bones of several, man-sized creatures are scattered about showing
deep cuts from some sharp object.  Oddly enough, some straw is also strewn
across the forest floor here.  Through the opening in the trees, you can see
a black castle on a mountain to the west.

Exits.Description: The edge of a small thicket is visible from here.
The dark woods look dense and it might be easy to lose your way.

rooms.Name: Climbing the fallen tree
rooms.Description:
You are nervously climbing on a fallen tree, inching your way along the
rough bark surface.  The rather steep angle makes your footing unsure and
you notice that the forest floor is rather far below you.

Exits.Description: The tree tops loom overhead.
The forest floor and the path are a long ways down.

rooms.Name: In the trees
rooms.Description:
You are climbing among the trees, high above the dark forest below.  
A cold wind howls through the branches here, chilling you to the bone.  
A fallen tree leans heavily against the branches here, angling down towards
the ground below.

Exits.Description: The thick foliage makes it impossible to see very far.

rooms.Name: The thicket
rooms.Description:
You are standing inside of a dense thicket made of brambles and other
bushes that all seem to be covered with long, sharp thorns.  The small
open area in the middle of the thicket has a thick, matted layer of
grasses where some large animal must sleep.  The heavy undergrowth 
shields you from the wind but the unnatural cold and silence of these
evil woods is still unnerving.

Exits.Description: The thicket obscures your view of the surrounding woods.

rooms.Name: In the trees
rooms.Description:
You are climbing through the trees, high above the forest floor in the
dark woods.  The ancient trees have huge limbs that are intertwined, making
it possible for you to move easily through the tree tops.  To the west you
can make out the shadowy outline of a small castle high above the forest
floor.

Exits.Description: The thick foliage makes it impossible to see very far.
The thick foliage makes it impossible to see very far.
The jump to the forest floor below looks pretty far.

rooms.Name: In the trees
rooms.Description:
You are high above the forest floor, carefully making your way along the
thick limbs that grow from these ancient trees.  The ground looks far below
but you notice a heavy rope tied to a branch here that leads down.  
You notice what appears to be the base of a cliff to the north through the
thinning undergrowth.

Exits.Description: The dense foliage makes it difficult to see very far.
The climb down the rope looks dangerous.

ExtraDescs.Description: The rope looks fairly strong, and in good condition.

rooms.Name: The base of the cliff
rooms.Description:
You are at the base of a very steep wall of rock that rises high above 
your head to the west.  The forest is thick, right to the very edge of this
cliff and the undergrowth is thick and nearly impassible.  You can see the
tower of a small castle looming above the edge of the cliff.

Exits.Description: The climb looks hard and dangerous.

ExtraDescs.Description: The rope looks sturdy and able to hold your weight.

rooms.Name: Off the forest path
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of the dark wood without any path to guide
you.  To the west you can see the bottom of a sheer wall of jumbled rock
that looks climable.  There is also a rope hanging from a branch high above
your head.  You shiver from the unnatural cold of this ancient forest.

Exits.Description:
You may be able to make your way through the undergrowth to the bottom of
the cliff.
The rope leads up into the branches of the tree high above your head.

ExtraDescs.Description: The rope looks sturdy and well able to hold your weight.

The cliff to the west is composed mainly of large boulders that lead up to
a ridge where you can see a small castle.

rooms.Name: On the side of the cliff
rooms.Description:
You are climbing on the side of a cliff, high above the dark woods that
spreads out as far as you can see to the east.  The wind is howling here and
you are forced to cling tenaciously to the rock to avoid plummeting to the
base of the cliff far below.

rooms.Name: In front of the castle
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of the Wicked Witch of the West's castle.
A drawbridge leads through a portcullis into the castle.  The castle walls
are crafted of jet black granite and have four watchtowers at each corner
connected by crenelated battlements.  There seems to be no road leading to
the castle, the only egress is from the cliff to the east.  A frigid wind
is blowing here and a deep sense of fear and loathing sweeps over you as
you stand before this evil place.

Exits.Description: A massive steel portcullis leads into the castle.
Climbing down the cliff looks difficult and dangerous.

rooms.Name: The inner courtyard
rooms.Description:
You are inside the Witch's castle, just inside the entrance.  Some wide
stairs lead up into the keep and to the battlements.  A large guardroom is
to the north but you cannot hear anything.  The area is lit with smoking
torches set into the walls which cast eerie shadows across the room.

Exits.Description: A heavy wooden door leads into the guardroom.
A massive portcullis seals the entrance of the castle.
Stairs lead up to a landing where you can see several doors.

rooms.Name: The guardroom
rooms.Description:
The guardroom for the Witch's Guards is large and uncluttered.  Several
rows of simple cots, tables, and chairs are arranged throughout the room.
The walls have torches set into holders high on the walls along with odd
pieces of antique weaponry and armor.  The room smells of leather and oil
and is meticulously clean.

Exits.Description: There is a heavy wooden door here.

ExtraDescs.Description: This is a typical folding camp chair made of wood and canvas.
This table is made of simple pine planks and is heavily worn from use.
You see a simple folding cot made of canvas stretched over a wooden frame.

rooms.Name: The landing
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a broad landing above the inner courtyard of the
Wicked Witch's castle.  Stairs lead down to the courtyard and also lead up
to the battlements which circle the castle.  There are several doors here.

Exits.Description: This wooden door is reinforced with metal.
The heavy door is reinforced with metal.
Stairs lead up to the battlements.

rooms.Name: The crystal ball room
rooms.Description:
This room is sparsely furnished except for a heavy stone chair facing a
pedestal with a round indentation on its top.  The room is lit with several
torches and has several slits in the walls but no windows.  Some rusty
shackles on the floor seem to indicate that this room could be used as some
sort of prison.

Exits.Description: The heavy door is reinforced with metal.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This simple stone pedestal has an odd, round indentation, probably designed
to hold a round object of some sort.

The chair is made of the same cut stones as the castle itself.  It does
not look comfortable and it is certainly impossible to move.

rooms.Name: The Witch's work room
rooms.Description:
This large room is dominated by a long, wide window that faces the front
of the castle.  Peering over the ledge makes your head spin as you see the
tremendous distance between you and the rocks far below.  The floor is sticky
with all sorts of foul substances and the long table in the center of the
room is crowded with all sorts of strange and arcane paraphenalia.  There
is a fire burning in a black hearth that oddly seems to add no heat to the
room.

Exits.Description: A narrow window ledge looks just wide enough to stand on.
This wooden door is reinforced with steel bands.
A heavy black curtains hangs in the archway.

rooms.Name: The eastern battlements
rooms.Description:
You are standing high above the Wicked Witch of the West's castle, on the
ramparts where guards patrol and keep watch.  Far below you can see a dark
forest that extends far into the mists that obscure the horizon.  There are
watchtowers at each corner of the ramparts.  Stairs lead down to the
courtyard below.

Exits.Description: A watchtower is to the north.
A watchtower is to the south.
Wide, well-worn stairs lead down.

rooms.Name: Off the forest path
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of the dark wood without any path to guide
you through the dense underbrush.  The unnatural quiet of the wood adds to
your sense of discomfort as you wander in search of a path or some landmark
to help you regain your bearings.

Exits.Description: The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.

rooms.Name: Off the forest path
rooms.Description:
After falling from the trees above you find yourself standing in the middle
of the dark wood without any path to guide you.  No paths or familiar
landmarks can be seen in any direction through the dense underbrush.

Exits.Description: The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.

rooms.Name: Off the forest path
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of the dark wood without any path to guide
you through the dense underbrush.  The unnatural quiet of the wood adds to
your sense of discomfort as you wander in search of a path or some landmark
to help you regain your bearings.

Exits.Description: The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.

rooms.Name: Off the forest path
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of the dark wood without any path to guide
you through the dense underbrush.  The unnatural quiet of the woods adds to
your sense of discomfort as you wander in search of a path or some landmark
to help you regain your bearings.

Exits.Description: The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.
The dense undergrowth hides what lies ahead from view.

rooms.Name: The northeast guardhouse
rooms.Description:
This roofed structure stands at the northeast corner of the battlements
high above the Witch's castle.  Open to the howling winds that rage around
the parapets, it offers little shelter from the elements.  Archways lead
both south and west along the top of the castle walls.

rooms.Name: The southeast watchtower
rooms.Description:
This roofed structure stands at the southeast corner of the battlements
high above the Witch's castle.  Open to the howling winds that rage around
the parapets, it offers little shelter from the elements.  Archways lead
both north and west from here.

rooms.Name: The Witch's chambers
rooms.Description:
A profound sense of horror overcomes you as you stand in the middle of
the Wicked Witch's sleeping chambers.  Despite the large bed in the center
of the room, you feel sure that the room is rarely used for sleeping but
instead for the Witch's warped and vile experiments on her unsuspecting and
certainly unwilling victims.  The shackles on the walls, the iron rings
on the bedposts, and the dozens of sputtering candles give the room the
appearance of a brothel, but you have no doubt that it is an abatoir.

Exits.Description: A heavy black curtain hangs in the archway.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This king-sized bed is low to the floor and has heavy iron rings attached
firmly to the sturdy bedposts.  A foul odor emanates from the sheets where
unspeakable stains and vermin make the bile rise up into your throat.

rooms.Name: In front of the castle
rooms.Description:
After surving the fall, you find yourself standing in front of the
Wicked Witch of the West's castle.  A drawbridge leads through a portcullis
into the castle.  The castle walls are crafted of jet black granite and
have four watchtowers at each corner connected by crenelated battlements.
There seems to be no road leading to the castle, the only egress is from
the cliff to the east.

Exits.Description: A massive steel portcullis leads into the castle.
Climbing down the cliff looks difficult and dangerous.

rooms.Name: On the window ledge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a narrow window ledge that hangs far above the ground
in the Witch's castle.  While you stand unsteadily in the howling wind, you
notice iron rungs anchored into the tower walls that lead up and down.

Exits.Description: A cluttered workroom lies just inside the window.
Iron rungs crawl up the side of the castle walls.
The iron rungs quickly end a few feet below the ledge.

rooms.Name: The Aerie
rooms.Description:
This foul-smelling chamber seems to have no exits besides a wide opening
that leads out into the air, high above the base of the Witch's castle.
The floor is covered with straw, filth, and crawling vermin that makes the
floor itself look alive.  Bones and gobbits of rotting flesh are scattered
about.  The wind howling outside the chamber does little to reduce the
overwhelming stench.

Exits.Description: Iron rungs lead down the wall of the castle.

rooms.Name: Climbing the outer wall
rooms.Description:
You are hanging on for dear life on some rusty iron handholds that are 
on the outer walls of the Witch's castle.  Above your head you can see a
large opening and below is a window ledge with the ground far below.  The
wind is blowing fiercly here and your hands are becoming numb.

Exits.Description: The iron rungs lead up to a dark opening.
The iron rungs continue down to the window ledge.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The old iron bars have been sunk deeply into the black granite walls of
the castle.  Once sturdy, they now are heavily rusted and the mortar is
loose and cracked.

rooms.Name: The poppy field
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of a huge field of poppies.  The heady
aroma of the flowers makes your head dizzy and you feel strangely sleepy.  
Through your drooping eyelids you can see the Emerald City to the west.

Exits.Description: Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
The Emerald City looms in the distance.

rooms.Name: The poppy field
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of a huge field of poppies.  The heady
aroma of the flowers makes your head dizzy and you feel strangely sleepy.
Through your drooping eyelids you can see the Emerald City to the west.

Exits.Description: Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
The Emerald City looms in the distance.

rooms.Name: The poppy field
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of a huge field of poppies.  The heady
aroma of the flowers makes your head dizzy and you feel strangely sleepy.
Through your drooping eyelids you can see the Emerald City to the west.

Exits.Description: Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
Poppies grow as far as the eye can see.
The gates of the Emerald City lies just beyond the poppies.

rooms.Name: Outside the gates of the Emerald City
rooms.Description:
You are standing before the gates of the Emerald City.  Gigantic green
stone walls as smooth as glass rise high into the sky above your head.
A massive door made of some sort of green wood has the word OZ deeply
carved into it.  A brilliant green glow illuminates everything here.

Exits.Description: A vast field of poppies lies to the east.
The door to the Emerald City towers above you.

rooms.Name: Inside the gates
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the common area just inside the entrance to the
Emerald City.  Several shops and buildings line the walkways here but they
are overshadowed by the magnificent palace that lies at the center of this
walled city.  Spectacular spires and breathtaking buttresses make the
castle look as if it is ready to leap into the heavens.  Within its walls
rules the most powerful mage in the land, the Wizard of Oz.

Exits.Description: A neat storefront is on the north side of the street.
The door leading out of the Emerald City is here.
The door to the shop looks inviting.

rooms.Name: At the palace entrance
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the entrance of the Wizard of Oz's castle.  This
incredible structure is composed entirely of translucent blocks of some
sort of green stone.  With needle-thin towers and a central dome that is
so transparent it is almost invisible, you realize that this place has been
magically enhanced.  Few mortals have tread within its walls and fear grips
your heart as you stand outside this place of power.

Exits.Description: The entrance to the Inn looks friendly and inviting.
A huge emerald door is the entrance to the castle.

rooms.Name: The Corridor of the Ages
rooms.Description:
You are in a long corridor that is softly lit by light streaming in 
through the emerald-colored windows that line its length.  Your footsteps
echo loudly here on the highly polished floor.  To the east you can see the
exit while at the far end to the west come strange sounds and odd flashes
of light.

Exits.Description: A glittering emerald door is to the east.
The corridor continues to the west.

rooms.Name: The Corridor of the Ages
rooms.Description:
You are at the midpoint of a long corridor that is lit with soft green
light that shines through the emerald colored glass windows that line the
length of the corridor.  You can see a door in the distance to the east
while to the west you can see odd flashes of light and strange sounds.
There is a small brass plaque at the bottom of the southern 
window.

Exits.Description: The corridor stretches into the distance.
The corridor stretches into the distance.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The plaque reads, "The Cowardly Lion made his famous leap through this
very window."

rooms.Name: The Corridor of the Ages
rooms.Description:
You are in a long corridor that is softly lit by the light shining through
the green tinted windows that line the hallway.  To the west you can hear
some odd hissing and crackling sounds.  There is a spiral staircase leading
up here.

Exits.Description: A long corridor stretches into the distance.
An emerald green door is to the west.
The stairs lead up to the guest wing.

rooms.Name: The Wizard's throne room
rooms.Description:
The Wizard's throne room is spectacular and awe-inspiring, as befits the
most powerful magic user in Oz.  A huge throne carved from a single, perfect
emerald sits between two huge cauldrons of green fire which belch huge
flames high into the room at regular intervals.  The room is lit from above
where a nearly transparent dome spans the ceiling.

Exits.Description: An emerald green door is to the east.
A curtain is hung across an opening here.
A panel is cleverly concealed behind the throne.
A spiral staircase leads up to the second floor of the palace.

rooms.Name: The control room
rooms.Description:
This small room is filled with odd, mechanical equipment whose purpose
you could not begin to guess.  Lever, buttons, and strange dials cover a
polished bronze panel and strange colored lights are blinking.  There is a
small silver plaque screwed into the base of the panel.

Exits.Description: A curtain is hung across an opening here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The plaque reads, "Manufactured by the Ace Novelty Company of Walla Walla,
Washington, USA.

rooms.Name: The bottom of the secret stairs
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the base of some steep stairs that wind steeply up
into the upper reaches of the Wizard's castle.  The passage is very narrow
and the steps are rather high.

Exits.Description: A tiny, narrow passageway slants up to the north.
A panel is cleverly concealed at the base of the steps.
The stairs wind up into the darkness above.

rooms.Name: The top of the secret stairs
rooms.Description:
You are climbing on a narrow, spiralling staircase that disappears into
the darkness below.  At the top of the stairs is a small alcove with a
small torch offering some illlumination.  A piece of rope hangs from a
trapdoor in the ceiling over your head.

Exits.Description: A trapdoor is above your head.
The stairs disappear into the darkness below.

rooms.Name: On the castle roof
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a windswept section of roof on top of the Wizard's
Castle.  Spectacular towers and irridescent domes surround you, and you
have a spectacular view of the Emerald City below.  The entire city seems
to glow with an unearthly green light which seems to emanate from the
palace itself.  A hot air balloon is anchored here which has a large wicker
basket hanging from a huge silk balloon which is swaying gently in the wind.

Exits.Description: You could easily clamber over the edge of the basket under the balloon.
A trapdoor lies at your feet.

rooms.Name: Overlooking the desert
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a ledge overlooking a great desert.  Hot winds are
blowing sand in twisting swirls on the dunes below.  Looking down you
realize that you could safelyl jump down.  To the south, a steeply
slanting passageway burrows its way into the earth below.

Exits.Description: The passageway slants downward into darkness.
You can jump down to the shifting sands safely from here.

rooms.Name: The Horse And Buggy Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This small shop is more like a barn than a store.  The interior has a
well-swept dirt floor covered with a thin layer of sweet-smelling straw.
The walls are covered with leather tack and the air smells strongly of
straw, leather, and manure.  There is a beautiful, ornate buggy here that
is for hire.

Exits.Description: A busy street lies outside the entrance.
The beautiful buggy is easy to climb up upon.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The buggy is beautifully made.  Painted a brilliant emerald green, the
coachwork is covered with ornate gold filigree.  The OZ Coat of Arms is
proudly displayed on its sides.  Why don't you climb aboard?

rooms.Name: In the buggy
rooms.Description:
You are sitting on the plush seats of a beautiful buggy.  Painted a deep
emerald green, the buggy is covered with beautiful gold filigree with the
OZ Coat of Arms displayed on each side.  Isn't this exciting?  Too bad the
horse hasn't been harnessed to the buggy, you could have gone for a ride.

Exits.Description: The shop floor is only a small jump away.

rooms.Name: Clean and Polish Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This establishment specializes in cleaning up weary (and dirty) travellers.
The shop is well stocked with all sorts of cleaning supplies, towels, soap,
and even stranger items like fresh straw and metal polish.  Best of all, a
large jacuzzi is bubbling away merrily in the center of the room.
There is a sign by the door.

Exits.Description: The shop door leads back onto the street.

ExtraDescs.Description: Please leave the key so others might enjoy themselves.

The jacuzzi is bubbling merrily and steam is billowing from its hot water.
It is rather large and can easily hold ten people.  You are tempted to take
a moment and relax in the water.  Hope it isn't too hot for you.

rooms.Name: In the jacuzzi
rooms.Description:
You are sitting in a large jacuzzi with hot water bubbling merrily around
you.  Steam is rising to the ceiling as the hot water drains the soreness
from your muscles and relaxes you completely.  Remember, don't stay in too
long!

rooms.Name: The dark closet
rooms.Description:
This musty closet is completely empty with the exception of a couple of
rusty hangers and some ancient cobwebs.

Exits.Description: The closet door smells of must and mothballs.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The hangers are the kind that are attached to the rob, like in cheap
hotels.  How annoying!

rooms.Name: The Pawnshoppe
rooms.Description:
This cramped and crowded store is overflowing with odd items and stranger
pieces of clothing.  Shelves stuffed with items all bearing a pawn ticket
line the walls of the store.  You can easily pick your way through the
mounds of stuff to reach the counter.

rooms.Name: In the balloon
