rooms.Description:
Climbing aboard the balloon may have been a mistake.  A strong gust of
wind broke the cables holding the balloon down and it quickly flew into the
sky with you in it!  As hours slowly passed, you have drifted across the
lush OZ countryside, across the Dead Desert, and are now floating above a
sprawling town that looks strangely familiar.  A nearby rooftop is a short
leap away!

Exits.Description:
A dirty rooftop lies beneath the balloon's basket.  If you jump carefully
you may not get hurt!

rooms.Name: The Inn of the Sitting Duck
rooms.Description:
The interior of this cozy Inn is warmly lit by a roaring fire built in a
large hearth on the west wall.  At the bank, a large bar offers the usual
beverages to the unusually well-behaved customers.  Simple pine tables and
benches offer plenty of seats for the customers to sit and relax.
There is a bill of fare on the wall.

Exits.Description: The door leads back out to the street.
A sturdy wooden door is behind the bar.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The stone hearth contains a large, roaring fire whose warmth you can feel from
anywhere within the Inn.  A heavy oak mantel and a stack of firewood are
also here.

The Bill of Fare reads:  Ale   40 coins
                         Beer   30 coins
                         Pretzels 5 coins

rooms.Name: The guest wing
rooms.Description:
This hallway is beautifully appointed with plush carpeting and murals
depicting the many adventures of the various heros of OZ.  Everything is 
lit with a gentle green light which makes you feel instantly relaxed and
at home.

Exits.Description: The Summer Suite is here.
The Winter Suite is here.
The Autumn Suite is here.
The Spring Suite is here.
The spiral stairs lead down to a corridor below.

rooms.Name: The Summer Suite
rooms.Description:
This brightly lit room is comfortably warm but the faint breeze coming 
from the ceiling fans slowly turning over the bed feels delightful.  All of
the furniture and decorations are various shades of yellow and white with
some exquisitely crafted rattan furniture filling the room.

Exits.Description: The exit to the room is here.

rooms.Name: The Autumn Suite
rooms.Description:
This guestroom has a faint chill in the air that is nicely offset by the
warmth offered from lights overhead.  The walls are nicely panelled in some
kind of exotic wood and the furniture is heavy and overstuffed.  There is
a fire burning in a hearth next to the high oaken bed in the corner.

Exits.Description: The exit to the room is here.

rooms.Name: The Winter Suite
rooms.Description:
The Winter Suite is somewhat chilly but the air is remarkably clean and
refreshing.  This guestroom is decorated with shades of blue and white,
with numerous glass ornaments and tabletops.  A plush white carpet on the
floor has the appearance of freshly fallen snow and the bed is covered with
thick piles of heavy white fur pelts.

Exits.Description: The exit to the room is here.

rooms.Name: The Spring Suite
rooms.Description:
This brightly lit room has warm, damp air appropriate for the dozens of
hanging plants and other decorative flowers that fill the room.  The pale
green decor goes well with this greenhouse-like room.  A rather large day
bed has flower petals scattered across it and looks rather inviting.

Exits.Description: The exit to the room is here.

rooms.Name: The Wizard's private chambers
rooms.Description:
This room is surprisingly small and simple, unlike the ornate and majestic
rooms that you have seen throughout the castle.  There is a small table here
surrounded by numerous chairs that is obviously used for informal meetings.
A large formal portrait of the Wizard hangs on the north wall.

Exits.Description: This beautiful portrait of the Wizard is quite large.
A spiral staircase leads down to the Throne Room.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The Wizard's portrait shows him riding in the basket below a huge hot air
balloon with 'Oklahoma State Fair' written in huge letters written across it.
The balloon is riding high above a rolling plain where brightly colored
tents can be seen far below.

rooms.Name: The Wizard's bed chamber
rooms.Description:
The Wizard's bedroom is small and homey, with simple furniture that he
must have brought from his homeland.  The only pieces of furniture is a bed,
bedside table and a bookcase filled with dusty tomes.  Spare but comfortable,
it is difficult to believe that the most powerful magical being in OZ
sleeps in the modest room.

Exits.Description: The wooden rear of the portrait can be opened here.

The bookcase is filled with various works on arcane, magical disciplines
and other subjects related to sorcery.

rooms.Name: A tiny narrow passage
rooms.Description:
This tiny passage is so narrow that you have to move sideways to squeeze
through.  It slants down towards the south.

Exits.Description: The rear of the hinged bookcase is barely visible.
The passageway slants downwards into darkness.

rooms.Name: The Stalagmite Cave
rooms.Description: This is a no entrance mob chute for the Gnome King area in the OZ zone.

rooms.Name: Off the forest path
rooms.Description: Mob chute for the dark forest area in the OZ zone.

rooms.Name: North of the crossroads
rooms.Description:
The road ends suddenly against a vast wall of thick, thorny undergrowth.
The growth looks very dense and the thorns look lethal.  The road
disappears under this barricade which you suspect is magical in origin.

rooms.Name: The southern battlements
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the southern battlements, high above the Wicked Witch
of the West's castle.  Far below you can see a dark, ancient forest that
covers the rolling landscape like an oily stain.  The wind is howling
and icy blasts of air chill you to the bone.

Exits.Description: A watchtower stands to the east.
A heavy door leads to the southwestern watchtower.

rooms.Name: The northern battlements
rooms.Description:
You are on the battlements on the northern side of the Wicked Witch of
the West's castle.  The spectacular view of the ancient forest below is
obscured by roiling mists and the icy winds that bring tears to your eyes.

Exits.Description: A watchtower stands to the east.
A heavy door leads to the northwestern watchtower.

rooms.Name: The beer cellar
rooms.Description:
This damp room is crowded with stacks of beer kegs that line the walls.
A sour, yeasty smell fills the room and the sound of scurrying feet
come from every direction.  Some sturdy steps lead back up to the inn.

Exits.Description: There is a door at the top of the stairs.

rooms.Name: The rear of the lair
rooms.Description:
The back of the Kalidah's lair is covered with a thick, rotting layer
of straw.  The nauseating, sickly-sweet smell of rot fills the air
while splintered bones crunch beneath your feet.
